translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Kumuda as the first of ten
The Story of the Elder Rattipupphi
“In the past I was a hunter
in a forest grove;
I saw the Buddha Vipassī,
the god of gods, the bull of men.
Seeing a flowering rattika
tree, a tree of the earth,
I pulled it up by the roots
and offered it to the Great Sage.
For ninety-one eons
I offered that flower;
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of offering a flower.
And in the eighth eon from now,
named Suppasanna,
endowed with the seven treasures,

analyzed: rājā ahosim mahat balaḥ  paṭisambhidā catasso
translated: I will be a powerful king.
The four analytical knowledges …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the elder Rattipupphi recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā rattipupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Rattipupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā rattipupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽rattipupphiya therassa apadānam
translated: The Story of the Elder Rattipupphi is the third.
